flow.descriptionCdata:
03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.00a83656-f7dd-4fba-a475-d1687d52716a.prompt=Process Instance ID 03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.18523fb5-bbd6-4822-8e6d-8fa2f84dc470.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.2ade7b2d-6603-47fd-9097-e356d02ad599.prompt=User Identifier 03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.30fec0af-369d-4f7f-b25b-02561a70c29e.prompt=User Identifier 03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.31c45546-c61f-44b1-8dfb-3e7b02d1a544.description=
This workflow updates service component display name.

Inputs-
componentId – Service component id
userIdentifier  - User Identifier id
displayName – Display name of the service component to be added
authType - The authentication type that this operation uses when trying to execute the request on the target server.
valid values\: basic, form, digest, ntlm, kerberos, anonymous (no authentication).
Default value\: anonymous - authentication not used when executing the request.
kerberosConfFile - The path to the Kerberos configuration file. If this input is empty the kdc (Key Distribution Center) and realm will get their values from the full domain name which is obtained from the url of the web server.
timeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for a connection to be established. This input should be assigned a value greater than or equal to zero. A timeout value of zero is an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0.
useCookies - If true, enables cookie tracking. Cookies will be stored between consecutive calls. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: true.
proxy - A proxy to use when accessing the web site.
proxyPort - The port on the proxy to connect to.
proxyUsername - The username to use when connecting to the proxy.
proxyPassword - The password to use when connecting to the proxy.
encodeURL - If true, automatically encodes the URL. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: false.
userAgent - The value that should be used if the HTTP header USER_AGENT has to be overridden.
trustAllRoots - If true, enables weak security over SSL. A SSL certificate is trusted even if no trusted CA issued it.
Default value\: true
keystore - URL of the keystore file or local path to it (e.g. %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts). It may be empty if HTTPS client authentication is not to be used.
keystorePassword - Password to unlock the keystore.
trustKeystore - URL of the truststore file or local path to it (e.g. %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts). It may be empty if HTTPS server authentication is not to be used.
trustPassword - Password to unlock the truststore.

Outputs-
document  – returned XML document from API
03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.32ca483b-52c2-497e-96cd-71a4dad7d52c.prompt=Process Instance ID 03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.37bec514-66be-4daf-b5fb-d1b76b1348b0.prompt=User Identifier 03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.37c43ef7-f794-43ad-a781-261afd837fe9.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.3dcdffdf-280a-41a8-994d-4593ce8eba07.description=
This workflow adds/updates the service component property using Artifact API.

Inputs-
componentId – Service Component  id
userIdentifier  - User Identifier id
displayName - Property Display Name to  add or update
propertyName – Property Name to add or update
onlyUpdate\: yes/no 
yes - To update values of existing property (In this case input "valueType" is not required , This input will not be considered even if provided)
no - To add/update property
valueType - Value type of the property. It can have value from selection list "HP CSA – Property ValueType". This Input is required only when Input "onlyUpdate" is selected as "no".
values - One or more values delimited by comma , (If user want to use some other separator for multiple values then needs to be pass as next input "separator")
separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the values ( default delimiter used is comma ,)
consumerVisible - Do you want to make property visible on consumer portal? (true/false), Default set to true
authType - The authentication type that this operation uses when trying to execute the request on the target server.
Valid values\: basic, form, digest, ntlm, kerberos, anonymous (no authentication).
Default value\: anonymous - authentication not used when executing the request.
kerberosConfFile - The path to the Kerberos configuration file. If this input is empty the kdc (Key Distribution Center) and realm will get their values from the full domain name which is obtained from the url of the web server.
timeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for a connection to be established. This input should be assigned a value greater than or equal to zero. A timeout value of zero is an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0.
useCookies - If true, enables cookie tracking. Cookies will be stored between consecutive calls. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: true.
proxy - A proxy to use when accessing the web site.
proxyPort - The port on the proxy to connect to.
proxyUsername - The username to use when connecting to the proxy.
proxyPassword - The password to use when connecting to the proxy.
encodeURL - If true, automatically encodes the URL. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: false.
userAgent - The value that should be used if the HTTP header USER_AGENT has to be overridden.
trustAllRoots - If true, enables weak security over SSL. A SSL certificate is trusted even if no trusted CA issued it.
Default value\: true
keystore - URL of the keystore file or local path to it (e.g. %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts). It may be empty if HTTPS client authentication is not to be used.
keystorePassword - Password to unlock the keystore.
trustKeystore - URL of the truststore file or local path to it (e.g. %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts). It may be empty if HTTPS server authentication is not to be used.
trustPassword - Password to unlock the truststore.

Outputs-
document  – returned XML document from API
03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.4620f287-8058-46d9-9810-b5e80234dff4.description=
This is an operation that does nothing. It can be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs and filtering them on the results tab.

Responses\:
    success
    failure
03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.55c3d279-8388-40c4-96c7-c166d0c8f27f.description=
Create a VM from a VM template. Must specify either hostSystem, clusterName, or vmResourcePool as a target location for VMs.

Input Parameters\:
 vmName - name of the VM that will be created with this flow
 templateName -  name of the VM template to clone in vCenter
 osType - linux or windows
 host -  vCenter host to execute against
 user - vCenter username
 password - vCenter password
 vmDatacenter -  target Datacenter on the vCenter host for the VMs
 dataStore -  target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs
 hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs
 clusterName - target cluster for the VMs
 vmResourcePool - target resource pool for the VMs
 CPUs - Number of cpus to be set on the VMs
 Memory - Amount of Memory in MB to be set on VMs. Memory should be a multiple of 4.
 port - Port Number toconnect on
 protocol - Connection prtocol(http, https)
 availableCPU - Available CPU in  vCenter
 availableMemory - Available Memory in MB in vCenter


Responses\:
 success - The operation completed successfully.
 failure - Something went wrong.
   

Result Fields\:
 vmId - VMID of the Clone
03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.59fa09fa-3fcc-48a2-aa2b-9dba0a75d9f4.description=
Retrieves details about an existing hard disk on a virtual machine (VM).

Inputs\:
    host - VMware vCenter, ESX or ESXi host hostname or IP.
    user - VMware username.
    password - VMware user's password.
    port - Port to connect on.
Examples\: 443, 80
    protocol - Connection protocol.
Valid values\: "https", "http"
    closeSession - Close the internally kept VMware Infrastructure API session at completion of operation.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
    virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
    vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type
Valid values\: "inventorypath", "name", "ip", "hostname", "uuid", "vmid"
    vmDatacenter - Virtual machine's datacenter.
    deviceNumber - The Hard disk number to get details of on the VM.
Examples\: If a VM as a hard disk named "Hard disk 1" the deviceNumber would be "1".

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed successfully.
    failure - Something went wrong. See returnResult for details.

Returns\:
    returnResult - Task result or operation result.
    allocatedSize - Size of the hard disk backing files in bytes.  If the disk is thin provisioned, this value will be lower then the provisioned size (vmDiskSize).
    diskPath - Path to the disk on the datastore.
    dataStore - Name of the datastore that contains this disk.
    diskMode - The disk persistence mode.  Possible values\: persistent, independent_persistent, independent_nonpersistent.
    thinProvision - Hard disk is thinly provisioned.  Possible values\: true, false.
    uuid - universally unique identifier (uuid) of the disk.
    vmDiskSize - The size of the hard disk in bytes.  If the hard disk is thinly provisioned, this is the provisioned size.
    diskSharesLevel - The vm hard disk shares level. 
    diskShares - The number of shares allocated to the hard disk. The "Normal", "High" and "Low" disk shares level map to a pre-determined set of numeric values for shares. The  "Custom" disk shares level does not map to a pre-determined set of numeric values for shares.
    parentListJS - If this disk has a delta disk backing file, this result contains a JSON array of the parent virtual disk backing files.
Example\: ["[datastore] path to\/parent virtual disk backing file.vmdk","[datastore] path to\/grandparent virtual disk backing file.vmdk"]

Notes\:
1. Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.

2. The "parentListJS" result can be used to determine the parent of a linked vm that share the same base disk storage. 

3. The "parentListJS" result will be populated with vSphere API 4.0 or greater.
03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.67306140-95de-4a9e-9ff6-8719300ea7dc.description=
This workflow adds/updates the service component property using Artifact API.

Inputs-
componentId – Service Component  id
userIdentifier  - User Identifier id
displayName - Property Display Name to  add or update
propertyName – Property Name to add or update
onlyUpdate\: yes/no 
yes - To update values of existing property (In this case input "valueType" is not required , This input will not be considered even if provided)
no - To add/update property
valueType - Value type of the property. It can have value from selection list "HP CSA – Property ValueType". This Input is required only when Input "onlyUpdate" is selected as "no".
values - One or more values delimited by comma , (If user want to use some other separator for multiple values then needs to be pass as next input "separator")
separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the values ( default delimiter used is comma ,)
consumerVisible - Do you want to make property visible on consumer portal? (true/false), Default set to true
authType - The authentication type that this operation uses when trying to execute the request on the target server.
Valid values\: basic, form, digest, ntlm, kerberos, anonymous (no authentication).
Default value\: anonymous - authentication not used when executing the request.
kerberosConfFile - The path to the Kerberos configuration file. If this input is empty the kdc (Key Distribution Center) and realm will get their values from the full domain name which is obtained from the url of the web server.
timeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for a connection to be established. This input should be assigned a value greater than or equal to zero. A timeout value of zero is an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0.
useCookies - If true, enables cookie tracking. Cookies will be stored between consecutive calls. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: true.
proxy - A proxy to use when accessing the web site.
proxyPort - The port on the proxy to connect to.
proxyUsername - The username to use when connecting to the proxy.
proxyPassword - The password to use when connecting to the proxy.
encodeURL - If true, automatically encodes the URL. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: false.
userAgent - The value that should be used if the HTTP header USER_AGENT has to be overridden.
trustAllRoots - If true, enables weak security over SSL. A SSL certificate is trusted even if no trusted CA issued it.
Default value\: true
keystore - URL of the keystore file or local path to it (e.g. %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts). It may be empty if HTTPS client authentication is not to be used.
keystorePassword - Password to unlock the keystore.
trustKeystore - URL of the truststore file or local path to it (e.g. %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts). It may be empty if HTTPS server authentication is not to be used.
trustPassword - Password to unlock the truststore.

Outputs-
document  – returned XML document from API
03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.79748ee6-2ab6-4354-b26a-6f24a30d6d6b.prompt=Process Instance ID 03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.8031a4a9-400f-494a-99fa-589eca0116a3.prompt=User Identifier 03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.86ac32b3-4014-46bc-9a89-60eeeddda7d7.prompt=User Identifier 03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.87349c1f-c6b1-4f5c-a466-22058c8be65f.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.8cf72630-6426-41d1-abcf-3f7bb5bfb0ed.prompt=Component ID 03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.a19e1b75-f045-4fc3-983a-677dfa4729f0.prompt=User Identifier 03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.aec537a8-c8a5-4592-b172-b577c8232c77.description=This workflow returns the component properties and values using Artifact APIs. result\: propertyNameValuesList\: pipe separated list of property name and values ( where each property name and values would be ; seprated and multiple values would be , seprated) e.g. - property 1; value1,value2|property 2; value3|property 3; value3,value4|........ 03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.c0b110e3-03f1-4e69-a246-56c2d530c901.description=
This workflow adds/updates the service component property using Artifact API.

Inputs-
componentId – Service Component  id
userIdentifier  - User Identifier id
displayName - Property Display Name to  add or update
propertyName – Property Name to add or update
onlyUpdate\: yes/no 
yes - To update values of existing property (In this case input "valueType" is not required , This input will not be considered even if provided)
no - To add/update property
valueType - Value type of the property. It can have value from selection list "HP CSA – Property ValueType". This Input is required only when Input "onlyUpdate" is selected as "no".
values - One or more values delimited by comma , (If user want to use some other separator for multiple values then needs to be pass as next input "separator")
separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the values ( default delimiter used is comma ,)
consumerVisible - Do you want to make property visible on consumer portal? (true/false), Default set to true
authType - The authentication type that this operation uses when trying to execute the request on the target server.
Valid values\: basic, form, digest, ntlm, kerberos, anonymous (no authentication).
Default value\: anonymous - authentication not used when executing the request.
kerberosConfFile - The path to the Kerberos configuration file. If this input is empty the kdc (Key Distribution Center) and realm will get their values from the full domain name which is obtained from the url of the web server.
timeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for a connection to be established. This input should be assigned a value greater than or equal to zero. A timeout value of zero is an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0.
useCookies - If true, enables cookie tracking. Cookies will be stored between consecutive calls. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: true.
proxy - A proxy to use when accessing the web site.
proxyPort - The port on the proxy to connect to.
proxyUsername - The username to use when connecting to the proxy.
proxyPassword - The password to use when connecting to the proxy.
encodeURL - If true, automatically encodes the URL. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: false.
userAgent - The value that should be used if the HTTP header USER_AGENT has to be overridden.
trustAllRoots - If true, enables weak security over SSL. A SSL certificate is trusted even if no trusted CA issued it.
Default value\: true
keystore - URL of the keystore file or local path to it (e.g. %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts). It may be empty if HTTPS client authentication is not to be used.
keystorePassword - Password to unlock the keystore.
trustKeystore - URL of the truststore file or local path to it (e.g. %JAVA_HOME%/jre/lib/security/cacerts). It may be empty if HTTPS server authentication is not to be used.
trustPassword - Password to unlock the truststore.

document  – returned XML document from API
03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.c83e34de-15ef-4679-b411-043633c49930.prompt=User Identifier 03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.description=
Provision a  Simple Vcenter Linux VM from a VM template. 

Inputs Parameters\:

 CSA_CONTEXT_ID – CSA Context Id
 CSA_PROCESS_ID – CSA Process Instance Id
 SVC_COMPONENT_ID - This token will resolve to the Service component Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\:SVC_COMPONENT_ID]
 RSC_PROVIDER_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Provider Id that was selected at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\:RSC_PROVIDER_ID]
 SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL - This token will resolve to the subscriber’s email address. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_EMAIL]
 RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Subscription Id that was created from the Resource Offering at the Subscription time.
  		Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]
 SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE - This token will resolve to the Service component type. Eg\: Server.. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_COMPONENT_TYPE]
 RSC_POOL_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource pool Id that was selected at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_POOL_ID]
 SVC_INSTANCE_ID - This token will resolve to the Service Instance Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_INSTANCE_ID]
 SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID - This token will resolve to the Subscription Id that was created at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID]
 PRN_COMPONENT_ID – This token will resolve to the parent Component’s Service Component Id. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: PRN_COMPONENT_ID]
 REQ_ORG_ID - This token will resolve to the Organization Id associated with the service request. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: REQ_ORG_ID]
 REQ_USER_ID - This token will resolve to the User Id associated with the service request. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: REQ_USER_ID]
 USR_ORG_ID - This token will resolve to the Organization Id associated with the subscriber. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: USR_ORG_ID]
 RSC_BINDING_ID - This token will resolve to the Resource Binding Id that was created at the Subscription time. Default value for this token is [TOKEN\: RSC_BINDING_ID]

Responses\:
 success - The operation completed successfully.
 failure - Something went wrong.
03f0d0fb-e395-413c-9a5c-007f47d79aed.e2e45fd0-df88-46c1-b7fd-92051029ce49.prompt=User Identifier
